name: Jamaican Escovitch Red Snapper
author: mrsjonze
summary: A traditional Jamaican red snapper recipe with a nice mix of tang and spice. Serve with traditional hard bread, corn bread, or white rice.
ingredients: 1 pound red snapper, gutted and scaled
1 tablespoon seasoned salt, or more to taste
1 tablespoon ground black pepper, or more to taste
½  Scotch bonnet pepper, seeded and sliced
directions: Wash red snapper thoroughly with water and lime juice
Let soak in lime water with 1 teaspoon black pepper in the refrigerator, 10 to 20 minutes
Mix flour, salt, and 1 tablespoon pepper in a shallow bowl
Pat snapper dry with paper towels and lightly coat both sides with flour mixture
Heat oil in a heavy frying pan until very hot
Deep-fry snapper until golden brown, 4 to 5 minutes per side
Pour out all but 3 tablespoons of the oil
Add onion, Scotch bonnet pepper, whole peppercorns, and allspice to the oil in the frying pan
Cook until onion softens, about 5 minutes
Pour in vinegar and stir until heated through
Add ketchup and simmer for 1 minute
Pour over hot snapper and let soak in
